intro: Impatiens uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, which bloom singly at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Impatiens uniflora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to add color to shaded garden spaces.
